description.narrative:
#Reducing Food Security by promoting (on farm) enterprise development through inter-cropping cultivation of fruit plants and vegetable in District Umerkot, Sindh#
Project Description #Reducing Food Security by promoting (on farm) enterprise development through inter-cropping cultivation of fruit plants and vegetable in District Umerkot Sindh#
With this project in Oxfam Novib with a new partner #Aware# will be implementing an innovative project in the target area. Concept of intercropping and enterprise development will be combined within this project by the implementing partners. Trees plantation and introduction of solar driers within the project will enable the two farmer association formed within the project to mature into future enterprises. Within the project the partner will also strengthen the capacities of target beneficiaries for enhancing production and incomes. This project will address the issue of poverty, food insecurity and non cultivation inter-cropping in the lands of UC Kajrari in Umerkot District of Sindh. Further there is lack of awareness in people about inter-cropping, value chain development and enterprise development. The people of targeted area have lack of knowledge and capacity to utilize available resources or take sometechnical and skilled steps to get rid of poverty and food insecurity. Due to which the people face lot of other problems and cultivate only traditional crops wheat, cotton, chilli etc. In the result, there is draught and famine situation in targeted area. AWARE through this intervention will raise awareness in people about importance of intercropping, value chain development and enterprise development by arranging sessions with farmers and general people and conducting the training of 120 farmers on enterprise development. Furthermore, 20 acres land of small land owner farmers (02 to 08) will be cultivated with vegetables like zucchini, potatoes, Tinda and fruits like Guava, lemon, Berries/Indian Jujube, Phalsa/Grewia asiatica and Water Melon for introducing the intercropping model. The training of 40 poor women will be trained on pickle making and packing for increasing their income at household level. One facilitation center will be established for providing agriculture related information to the farmers of targeted UC throughout the project period. One association of farmers will be formed to promote awareness in other farmers about inter-cropping and value chain development. This project will benefit to 23,120 people of targeted district directly by supporting them through different channels.

participating-org.narrative:
AWARE (Association for Water Applied Education & Advocacy) has extensive professional local NGO is promoting education through alternative energy. The vision of AWARE is to be an endeavoring and an effective contributor to the establishment of a society, where people determine their choices in life and influence the direction of change is proactive to empower communities for improvement of their social and economic conditions through different sources. Aware mission is to organize, aware, strengthen andempower the marginalized sectors of population to enabling them to influence social, political and economic policies and decision making to make possible to establish a society based on social justice, equity, equality and human dignity.
The objective of Aware is to organize different sectors of population in order to involve the community in: identifying, understanding the community needs; identification, development, management and judicious use of natural resources particularly renewable energy resources; and development, management, improvement and maintenance of public facilities.To provide the people suitable economic and research activities to build their development, management and leadership capacities/capabilities and to improve/develop their occupational/professional skills so as to strengthen their economic position. The area of operation is Sindh province but at present the focus is on two Districts; Tharparkar andUmerkot. Renewable Energy and Applied Education are focused for poverty reduction. An intensive study of underground water quality in Thar is conducted with support of Pakistan Council of Scientific & Industrial Research (PCSIR) Laboratories Complex Karachi, Neuro Medicine Department of Dow Medical University Karachi, Geology Department of Karachi University, an intensive study of water quality in Thar was conducted and this took more than 05 years in completion. AWARE is striving for empowerment of the excluded and the marginalized segments of society and to reform their social and economic conditions.
Association for Water, Applied Educ & Renewable Energy
